com.anotherservice.rest.security

Class Security

  • Object
    • Security

  • public class Security
extends Object
    This class is a Thread safe Singleton getter for a ISecurity for the REST service The security instance cannot be changed after setting it.
    Author:
    Simon Uyttendaele

    • Method Detail

      • getInstance

        public static ISecurity getInstance()
        Returns the ISecurity instance
        Returns:
        the unique ISecurity instance
        Throws:
        RuntimeException - if the instance has not been set

      • setInstance

        Sets the ISecurity instance

      • escape

        public static String escape(String text)
        Escapes the provided text for safe usage in a SQL statement. Adds a leading backslash ("\") to the following characters 0x00, \n, \r, ', ", \, 0x1A
        Parameters:
        text - some text
        Returns:
        the escaped text or an empty string if the original text is null

      • escape

        public static String escape(String text,
            boolean strict)
        Escapes the provided text for safe usage in a SQL statement. Adds a leading backslash ("\") to the following characters depending on the strict mode:
        • strict: 0x00, \t, \n, \r, ', ", \, 0x1A, 0x08, %, _
        • non-strict: 0x00, \n, \r, ', ", \, 0x1A
        Parameters:
        text - some text
        strict - strict mode
        Returns:
        the escaped text or an empty string if the original text is null

      • unescape

        public static String unescape(String text)
        Unescapes the text that was previousely escaped. Removes leading backslash ("\") to the following characters 0x00, \t, \n, \r, ', ", \, 0x1A, 0x08, %, _
        Parameters:
        text - some text
        Returns:
        the unescaped text or an empty string if the original text is null

      • unescape

        public static String unescape(String text,
              boolean strict)
        Unescapes the text that was previousely escaped. Removes leading backslash ("\") to the following characters depending on the strict mode:
        • strict: 0x00, \t, \n, \r, ', ", \, 0x1A, 0x08, %, _
        • non-strict: 0x00, \n, \r, ', ", \, 0x1A
        Parameters:
        text - some text
        strict - strict mode
        Returns:
        the unescaped text or an empty string if the original text is null
